solution_line_template: On the second day, Maria sold {first_day_tulips} * {doubling_factor} = <<{first_day_tulips}*{doubling_factor}={second_day_tulips}>>{second_day_tulips} tulips.
She also sold {first_day_roses} * {doubling_factor} = <<{first_day_roses}*{doubling_factor}={second_day_roses}>>{second_day_roses} roses the second day.
On the third day, Maria sold only {third_day_tulip_percentage} * {second_day_tulips} = <<{third_day_tulip_percentage}*{second_day_tulips}={third_day_tulips}>>{third_day_tulips} tulips.

Over these three days Maria sold {first_day_tulips} + {second_day_tulips} + {third_day_tulips} = <<{first_day_tulips}+{second_day_tulips}+{third_day_tulips}={total_tulips_sold}>>{total_tulips_sold} tulips.
So on the tulips Maria earned {total_tulips_sold} * {tulip_price} = $<<{total_tulips_sold}*{tulip_price}={tulip_earnings}>>{tulip_earnings}.
In total, over these three days, Maria has earned {tulip_earnings} + {rose_earnings} = $<<{tulip_earnings}+{rose_earnings}={total_earnings}>>{total_earnings}.
